Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Dave K
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a really nice part of the city only 2 mins walk to shops pubs ect. We had a lovely view of the canal and had a really nice time. The tea and coffee machine is a great idea and the free wi-fi made is easy to stay in touch with home. The only bad thing i have to say about it is the bed was like a brick after walking for hours id love a nice soft bed to stay in and that it wasn't. If they changed the beds id defo be back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: sante0910
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here, for our 3year anniversary, we chose to stay here, because it was well priced, and literally 15mins walk to Rembrandt Square, so no worries about going out on a night out, and looking for expensive taxis, or metros!! The rooms are small, but just perfect, the decor is cute!, My only prob was the bathrooms are that small, that myu knees touch the wall, but the perks of the hotel out-weigh that minor thing! Luckiyl we were on the 3rd floor, because there are no lifts. but a bit of walking up and down stairs is burn off all the booze n great food you can eat out while being in Amsterdam! Breakfast is 6Euros per person, and is good food! well worth the 6euros after a cracking night out!! and the best thing....... FREE CUPS OF TEA/COFFEE/LATTES... AND JUICE 24HRS A DAY!!. The staff are extremely helpful, and kind!!! A definate place to stay!! Just to thanks to all the staff at the hotel from myself and husband. We stayed 20th Jan 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended! Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Bertiane G
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple room. There's no lift, but the rooms are very good and the interior design is cute. And the view is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: sampion
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant surprise, for 55 eur for a double room wuth en-suite bathroom - it can't get better! The location is excellent, away from the touristy bit, overlooking the lovely Hermitage museum and the Amstel canal, this is a very lovely budget hotel that you can find in Amsterdam. Do not expect 5 star facilities, but everything works for its purpose. The room was very clean, with fresh linen and very comfortable ber and pillows. Bathroom spotless as well. We did not try the breakfast as it was 9 eur per person, so can not comment on that. The best bit is that all guests can enjoy free drinks(coffee, non-alchoholic beveregs.tea) in the breakfast room on ground floor, a very pleasant perk for the guests. Yes, the walls are a bit thin, and you might hear other guest but this is an old, charming Dutch building so I would say that is quite normal. Stff was efficent and helpful, will give you all needed information and are quite knowledgable. I would recommend this hotel if you are using it as a base for your trip in Amsterdam. Also saving on the hotel cost, will give you more to spend on the lovely hand-made chocolates which you can buy from Puccini near the Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and quick service”
Reviews.Author: AlinaVel
Reviews.Content: We had an action price, which turned out to be cheaper than a hostel for two. Stayed there only one night. Service was very efficient and quick, for both checking in and out. Indeed, the toilet is very small. It's easy to sit there side ways. But rooms are big, clean and fresh. The only negative point: the pillow was rather bad...

Reviews.Title: “had a good time”
Reviews.Author: anastas n
Reviews.Content: i went there with friends last summer and we had a very nice time... staff was verry good with our group and very helpful.. the best thing was the big room where we could stay all together so that we could keep up with the things we wanted to do... also amsterdam is very beautifull city to visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Will definitelt be back!”
Reviews.Author: annamc55
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights this hotel with my boyfriend. We both loved it! The hotel is in a great location, easy to get to from the airport with the train to central station and then hop straight onto the number 9 tram to just around the corner from the hotel. It is situated by two canals and in a quiet part of town...you will get sleep! (however 5 minutes cycle and you can be in Chinatown or the red light district) The hotel was clean. Hot chocolate, tea and coffee free all day long in the kitchen downstairs. The room was clean, comfortable and the shower was great! The decor of the hotel is great-everything in our room was black, grey and white...lots of fun! The room was cleaned every day. The only complaint I would have is that breakfast (if you want it) is 9 euro. I am not sure if this is normal in Amsterdam but I felt this a bit expensive. Having said that there are many breakfast places near by! Also Mac Bike rental is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Renting a bike is a must, make seeing Amsterdam so easy and so much fun! Staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel is clean and comfortable. Location is perfect! Oh and free Wifi!

Reviews.Title: “its disgusting, cramped, noisy, overpriced... A joke!”
Reviews.Author: Larissa91
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights with my partner in a small double room, if only we listened the bad reviews because it was an absolute hole. I can say nothing good about the rooms as they were the let down of the century. Its a centre for ants! There was no bloody room to go to the toilet and you had to sit sideways as the room between the toilet and the wall was little more than 5cm. You have to step over the toilet to get to the shower and theres no curtain so the whole bathroom gets soaked. Plus the bathroom reeks of mildew, i doubt they clean it. Positives- free drinks all day and they have a good coffee machine, and the male receptionist was quite pleasant and helpful. Overall, you're better off staying in a crowded hostel for a quarter of the price as this is an absolute joke of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the bedbugs and lice!!”
Reviews.Author: MSVS_2011
Reviews.Content: Our stay looked great, the rooms are small, but cosy and the personnel friendly. But during the night, we felt bedbugs and lice crawling in our beds. It got so bad that my sister slept on the floor, because the bugs and the itching were driving her crazy! We spoke to the manager that morning, but his reaction was: " could they go to other rooms too? " He did not even apologize! He wanted to offer us a free breakfast or 10 euro discount. When we said we could not agree with this, he called the owner. This made it even worse, because the owner suggested we brought the bedbugs ourselves!! After this comment, we said we did not wanted to pay for our room, because we did not even sleep at all and we were being accused of bringing dirty bugs and lice with us. Honestly, it is really not about the money, but sleeping in one bed with bedbugs and lice is not something that is acceptable in any hotel. After half an hour of discussions the manager decided we did not have to pay. But overall, the service was really bad and the rooms are (so it seems) not clean!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: klanette
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not too far by taxi from the train station. It was about 100 euros a night and was very clean. We had a room facing the back so it was quiet at night as well. We had a triple which was three twins beds that were comfortable and a bathroom with a toilet, sink and shower. Very, very small but clean. The young man at the front desk was very helpful and booked our taxi for us the next morning as well as giving us directions to a good restaurant in the area. The area around the hotel is lovely with all the canals. The only drawback was that there are no elevators so we had to haul very heavy suitcases up to the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “There are pros and there are cons...”
Reviews.Author: Juxx
Reviews.Content: have lived in a'dam before so trust me when i say that the location is fab. right in the centre but away from the nasty bits. tram no. 9 takes you straight from centraal station to "waterlooplein", which is a 5 min walk from the hotel. you can also rent bikes from macbike which is, again, 5 mins away from the hotel - do ask the hotel for the 2euro off voucher! other pros: - friendly staff - free drinks - free (and very good!) wifi now the cons. 1. NO LIFT. i wonder why this hasnt been an issue for other reviewers but lugging 20kg up three storeys of typical dutch canal house stairs is no joke... 2. SERIOUSLY SMALL BATHROOM, esp. the space between (excuse my being explicit) the potty and the wall right in front of you. let's say i could not keep my legs together when using the loo! the sink is also the size of a salad bowl so doing your own laundry is out of the question... 3. AVERAGE CLEANINESS. lots of random pieces of litter on the floor (not mine) even after cleaning... also make sure you leave the room before 11am else your room will not be cleaned... I would come back for the location but for 120euro+ per night i think (hope) there are better choices out there...

Reviews.Title: “Was a comfortable stay, for 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: gigglesxhx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a comfortable stay for two nights. Free drinks were available which was a very good part of the stay. The bathroom was very nice although small and in close proximity of the room. The only negative aspects were that the blind/curtain did not work, the noise from people walking up and down the stairs was annoying when trying to sleep, and two water pipes were exposed which was quite dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “COZY!! AWAY FROM NOISE! FRIENDLY and HELPFULL STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Riana-22
Reviews.Content: Location close to all attractions, beautifull surroundings!! (stayed 2 days) Whenever I have to stay over in Amsterdam again, I will dfinitely book again with the Hotel Hermitage. (door-to-door airport to hotel & back transport available)

Reviews.Title: “A trendy hotel tucked away from all the hustle and bustle. A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: BandeleZuberiPhoto
Reviews.Content: I love this place!!! Located in a quiet area but within walking distance of all the sights. Staff were excellent and extremely friendly! Our room was fantastic with trendy decor, plenty of space (for 5 of us!) and the bonus of free wifi, you also get free coffee/tea/hot chocolate from a vending machine! I'll definitely stay here again on my next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Black & white wonder”
Reviews.Author: uehala
Reviews.Content: Lived there in March last year for 3 days! is located in the building in 1716, while inside it is very modern and comfortable. Friendly staff. Very stylish hotel. Kitchen, hallways and rooms are decorated in a style in black and white color scheme. Nice rooms with large windows. Warm, clean, comfortable room. The hotel has its own kitchen, which You can use it. Convenient location in the heart of Amsterdam. Affordable price. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & service”
Reviews.Author: helbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my fiancÃ© March 2011. Lovely hotel, really good value (â‚¬104 for a large double, inc free tea/coffee all day) The staff were very pleasant and more than happy to advise where to go, what to do etc. The room was large and overlooked the garden to the rear of the hotel. The shower room was clean & large enough for 2 people. My only issue with this lovely hotel was the comfort of the bed, it was a little bit too hard for my liking. I think some people may have expected too much with the size of the rooms from a hotel in Amsterdam but this certainly didnt disappoint me. I have stayed in much smaller rooms and paid a lot more. This is a charming hotel and was definitely worth the money we paid, I would definitely go back, despite the bed! The location is great, only a 5min walk from the busy Rembrantplein or Waterlooplein

Reviews.Title: “It was the biggest disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Cuca1975
Reviews.Content: It was the biggest disappointment. The photos of the hotel we saw at the site, has nothing to do with the reality of the hotel. They should be prosecuted because it appeals to this misleading advertising! It's all old, except the bathroom, which is a cubicle, it only fits one person at a time. Sheets with holes and small for the size of bed that did not even have anything to protect the mattress. Where breakfasts are other cubicle, a simple kitchen smaller than any other cuisine we have at home. The chairs are all scratched by the cat who lives there in the kitchen. (note the cat was the nicest of all). Tip: Do not go, do not be deceived. It was the worst hotel I have been staying. I do not consider a hotel but more a shelter from the lowest possible. I do not understand, as the hotel was well rated, but probably the owner must have paid someone ..... Simply awful

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodation - worth the money (if you have cash) read on...”
Reviews.Author: RICK2020
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here September 21 Thru 25 2010. We both had our own single rooms. His was on the second floor and mine on the 4th. His single room had a shower and bathroom but mine only had a sink as I had a separate room down the hall that was my own private shower and bathroom. If you stay in room 408 as I did you will have a separate bathroom which I didn't really mind (also my room was slightly larger since it didn't have the inside bathroom.) The hotel has a nice boutique feel to it and is very narrow and cosy and close to most things - Amsterdam is a walkable city - Our Hotel was 20-25 minutes walk from Central station and we could get anywhere we wanted within 30 minutes walk... There were only 2 problems with our stay - the 5 days we were there they were relaying the brick street in front of out hotel so starting at 8AM on the weekdays you could hear the constant clankety clank of the men outside working. I slept with earplugs on which solved the problem. Luckily the men did not work on weekends. Unfortunately my friend on the second floor whcih was practically street level could hear everything because they have his window permanently ajar about 4 inches with a wooden beam so the noise comes through. The last issue we had (and it's something I read about this hotel from another review) - When we checked out and it was time to pay - they told us the credit card machine was down and could we pay with cash. Well since my stay was only 230 Euro's total - I was able to do so. Can't imagine what would happen to someone that was counting on paying with a credit card and did not have the cash. Pretty sure it's a scam because the Hotel probably has to pay a fee to use the credit cards and would rather avoid those fees. Other than that the Hotel was fine. Will most likely stay at another bigger Hotel without the shady credit card issues next time. Amsterdam is worth visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Frank12345186605
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hermitage Hotel, and for â‚¬168 per night it was very poor value. Had a small room on the 5th floor, about the size of a prison cell, with a sloping roof. Stairs are narrow and almost dangerous. Despite saying wifi in all rooms it only covers the lower area of the hotel. Am covered in insect bites. Location is good, and staff do their best to be helpful. Try to avoid this place

Reviews.Title: “BEST 2 star i have ever stayed in Amsterdam!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amadues
Reviews.Content: Good location very very clean cheap friendly good decoration... Do you expect more from a 2 star??? Ä° dont! This is a very very good value!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: BeckyR3
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff were very nice and helpfull and the hotel looked nice couldn't book in till 3pm on the day but got they at 10am it was a long wite to get in to the room the bathroom was small and so was the bedroom the problem was the bed it had bedbugs or something that ate us alive we didn't have one goodnights sleep and the bed was never changed when we were they and they was stains on the carpet didn't look to hard

Reviews.Title: “Hermitage Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BeckyR3
Reviews.Content: nice looking hotel friendly staff but the beds had bedbugs or some thing we were eaten alive didnt have one good nights sleep because of it. got up at 5 am the day we left just to get out of the place

Reviews.Title: “dodgy”
Reviews.Author: Melanie747
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for -thankfully- only one night. I was there with a friend from abroad because we thought it would be fun to stay in a hotel after a concert in Paradiso. But it wasn't fun at all, for me. After reading the reviews here and seeing the pictures, I too was convinced by the modern decor. But in my opinion, the whole black&white&silver theme is just a cover up for everything that lacks. All I need is a good bed, and a cup of tea before I go to sleep, which was not possible. It starts after entering the very narrowl hallway with the receptionm, which is faced sideways. We where helped by the man with the long hair aswell, and yes he was nice. However you couldn't pay with a bankcard (weird) so I had to go out to get cash. The receptionist said he needed my ID while I would get money from a cashmachine! What? I said no, this felt wrong, never experienced this before. This al felt very dodgy to me. I also do not appreciate people who run a company in the Netherlands, not speaking dutch. I am very international and speak several languages, but in my own country I expect to communicate in dutch! Thankfully my friend had cash on her, cause really , I am not giving my passport to anyone.The guy joked that they would only use it for making fake ID's. But why should I trust them with my passport, if they can't trust me I will come back with money to pay the room? In our reservation it said we would have the small twin room on the 5th floor, but we where given the "nicer "room, which was located between the reception and the breakfastroom.(which means you hear people walking in and out, you hear the staff, you hear the breakfastroom being set up and an unsafe feeling cause there are no locks on the door and the hotel has the door open 24/7). At first glance, yes it looks nice. but look a little harder, and you discover the looks are just a decoy. First the mosquitos, they where everywhere, I am covered with bites. they where even in the shower. Then the lack of remote for the tv (no problem for us, but if you stay there longer it might be) no tea&coffe facilities eventhough it said every room in this hotel would have. The lights near the beds didn't work. which meant if you had to go to the toilet during the night you would have to find your way in the dark to the main lightswitch. and then the bed. It was the worst I have ever slept in, and I've slept in some crappy situations. It was rockhard, I didn't even know hard matrasses that hard existed, it was torture, my whole body hurt. And the the odd smell, which I found out came from the wall nex to my bed; it was completely wet, with the wallpaper coming of it. Not only did this smell nasty, but for me as I am asthmatic, it meant I coughed all night. It was also very very hot in the room, but leaving the window open was not really an option as it faced the backyard where people where walking in and out, also we already had enough mosquitos inside anyway. The bedsheets which where too small for the matrasses, looked very poor. You don't care for the nice decor after all this. And really, you can't call this a designhotel (which I have seen stated here and there on the net), think ikea, it may look nice but it's just cheap. It's just a decoy. the most important thing in a hotelroom is a good bed, and it was horrible. Only the next morning I found out, after being amazed that my friend actually did get some sleep, that her matrass was completely different, and somewhat softer, She was shocked after trying mine for just a minute. Also, she did not sleep against a wet, smelly wall. which by the way is not just unhealthy for people with astma, but in general. I guess I chose the wrong side of the room. That night in that hotel, on the rockhard bed, near the wet wall , in the heat, being accompanied by mosquitos was hell to me. Therefore I would not recommend this hotel to anyone , unless you really don't care about anything than a roof over your head. I couldn't wait for it to be morning (no sleep all night) and ofcourse we did not try the breakfast for 9,95 euro, you can get real coffee and good food elsewhere for this money. I wanted to get out of there a.s.a.p. When we checked out there was a cranky older woman standing behind the reception to whom it was apparantly too difficult to say good morning. After waiting for minutes she finally grunted ; yes? As in what do you want. After we said we wish to check out she asked; have you payed for the room? Well yes, in cash might I add, she just kept looking at us. Why don't they keep track of such essential things?Than finally she asked if we had questions (?) then we got our bill. They couldn't even bother to spell my name correctly, I was referred to as Melaine both in person as on the bill. It also still had the old name of the hotel on it (again, weird).Never had such a weird experience both with checking in and checking out. Dodgy!! what's with the paying cash (or with credit card against an additional 4% charge) what's with the wanting to keep your passport, are they so afraid that after seeing just the reception you will not come back? Why not invest in sheets that fitt the matrass, even if it would be the cheapest they could find. The only thing that was ok was the bathroom. although it is tiny yes, everything worked fine and it was clean. But overall; horrible! Never again. I tried taking some pictures of the room, but because of all the black wallpaper the room was so dark, the camera of my mobile phone didn't work well.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, good location, wont stay there again”
Reviews.Author: botnim
Reviews.Content: the location is the best part, being a walking distance from city center, and yet a bit far off the noise, in a quiet street. staff wasnt nice and we tried to avoid any contact. the room we got was really tiny, and on the fifth floor with a steep climb. the place is decorated nice and relatively clean. we wont stay there again, as we felt the room was very expensive relative to what you get. next time we would look for a better place for the same money. the only reason we dont recommend this hotel is that we feel that for the same money we could have gotten a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: saffaonthemove
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a quick, 8 minute walk to the conference centre at oudemanshuispoort, at the University of Amsterdam. Its right on a quiet, but picturesque canal, and is very close to rembrandts square. The service was great, the breakfast perfect for my needs and I loved the decor. My room was modern and exceptionally clean. My windows opened all the way up - and the hotel staff went out and bought all new fans when the city was hit by a heat wave - wonderful! I have read some of the other most recent reviews and its quite clear to me that none of the other reviewers have stayed anywhere else in the city. I have stayed at a 4 * hotel on the Dam recently - that was aweful and double the price. No windows opened, no air co, awful staff, very old decor, even smaller rooms.... I think hotel hermitage is a rare gem in a city with not alot of fab hotels....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonHotelJunkie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after searching quite a bit. The hotel was recently renovated and looks good. we got a triple room, and it looks tight, but we weren't getting on each others way. the place was clean, and we were happy with it. as far as cons: -for our triple room, the windows didn't open all the way. since there's no AC neither, it was a little warm even at night. -the bathroom is indeed as small as it looks. the major thing about the bathroom is that the toilet is so close to the sink, it's hard to sit straight on the toilet since the knees would hit the sink cabinet. one of the guys was cool, the long haired one. he was very helpful, and gave us tips. the other guy, bigger guy, wasn't as cool. it's near rembrandt square, which is a cool area to hang out at night. i would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Quaint”
Reviews.Author: tomatocloud
Reviews.Content: Tiny cozy place. Beautiful interiors. Modern, good quality furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if claustrophobic”
Reviews.Author: iguanaUk
Reviews.Content: In 12 years of staying in hotels around the world, this is the first one I have ever complained about. Tiny bathroom, not even enough space to squeeze between the toilet and the wall to get to the shower. Single room was quite claustrophobic and a strange layout. Not very well-informed staff, couldn't even say where any internet cafes could be found nearby. Surely it is not to much to expect from a hotel in a large city to know these things and be able to point them out on a map? I don't expect to be told to ask in the nearest coffeshop instead as they may know the answer! No fire alarms but was woken at 3am by lots of shouting outside and what sounded like someone jumping out of the 1st floor window drunk? Unharmed though. But that could happen anywhere in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “fab room, stylish decor, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: devilmaycareUk
Reviews.Content: Having taken what seemed like a bit of risk when we booked 3 nights at the Hermitage after reading some of the reviews here, we were very happily surprised by the stylish decor of both the public areas and our double room on the 4th floor. The en suite shower and toilet was small, but very new, as was all the furniture in the smallish, but by no means cramped bedroom. We liked the black, white and grey theme. The staff were pleasant and very willing to provide good advice about restaurants etc, and although small, without an elevator (the typical situation in Amsterdam with hotels of this size and class), or air con, the Hermitage is great and we'd definitely return there. It's in a good location, too, right opposite the new Hermitage Museum building, and just a 3 minute walk from Waterlooplein. We were awoken at 8 am 2 mornings by the current building work on the museum, but this will no doubt be completed very soon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is EXCELLENT! Dont read the bad reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: djannika
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a stay at this hotel. I went for a weekend with 7 other friends. I had read all the reviews i could find and the bad outweighed the good i was so nervous that it was going to be a dump lol but i was soooo suprised, the hotel has completly been renovated and the decor is beautiful. I stayed in a large double room which was very large had a double bed and two arm chairs, en suite bathroom with shower (so nice). Cleaners in everyday fresh towels make beds etc. Some of my friends stayed in triple rooms which were a great standard too. There was flat screen tv's in all the rooms, which i had read there was none so that was a nice suprise. Staff were extra nice, we asked about a comedy show and the guy at reception, he even phoned down to the theatre for us. There was no bar in the hotel or lift but there was a bar just around the corner and you can get over the stairs lol. The restaurant also only served breakfast in the morning, no lunch or dinner. But there are nice restaurants close by. Location was brill, not even a 5 minute walk to rembrant square. Tram line is literally a 3 min walk and you can get around the rest of the city from here. Also close to coffee shops if thats what your looking for. To sum it all up, i cant believe this hotel is only 2 star. I would stay here again. Look at the photos!!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have very high expectations.”
Reviews.Author: AldoGeneva
Reviews.Content: The hotel fire alarm went off three times between midnight and dawn. The receptionist explained it was people smoking joints in their rooms. We had a triple room. It was cramped, but then so is most Amsterdam accommodation. The bathroom was so small that you couldn't sit without opening the door. But it was clean, the beds were comfortable and the pillows seemed to be made of a block of tyre rubber. Our room had nice big windows and a view across a canal. The breakfast was very ordinary for â‚¬9 extra. They didn't charge us for the one breakfast we had because of the fire alarm. Th staff were friendly but tiresomely bureaucratic, demanding a driver's licence or passport in case we bilked. The hotel has made an attempt at a distinctive interior styling, but the fake Russian writing is naff. It is well situated in a quiet and relatively open part of town, near some picturesque bridges and Rembrandt Square. For us it was a perfect location with great walks to every destination in central Amsterdam. Value for money: in absolute terms it's expensive for what it offers; relative to other hotels of this category in Amsterdam, I expect you could do worse.

Reviews.Title: “hotel name has changed and advertised inaccurately”
Reviews.Author: shilam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is now called Hotel Hermitage Amsterdam, it advertises all rooms with flatscreen tv, telephone and coffee making facilities, however none of the rooms actually had these. Everything was clean however we paid for a large double room but were given a small double room, they advertised it had a canal view which is true however there is also construction work which is very loud across the canal. The staff were helpful but the person at reception was unhelpful and seem to have some attitude, he seem to think it was laughable we expected a tv in the room, he apologised when he realised it was their hotel that advertised this on the website. I didnt find it was close to anywhere plus we were placed on the fourth floor and there is no elevator, not good if you are young or old, as an elderly person would not be able to climb up at least 6 sets of stairs and the young tend to go out and could have a horrible accident, the cancellation policy is to pay for the first night of stay, so we stayed the first night cancelled in the morning which he refused to accept and required us to pay for 2 nights instead, we were so unhappy we decided to pay for 2 nights without staying and moved on to another hotel (armada) with was cheaper, had all of the above facilities, brilliant staff and included a great breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carrie3107
Reviews.Content: Thank you for spoiling a perfect holiday!!!! You could have told us that you were closed before we travelled to Amsterdam so we could organise alternative arrangements. Bad organisation. We have had to sleep on the streets thank you

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting place we have ever been ...”
Reviews.Author: katrinreist
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from a four-day-trip to Amsterdam and we are still horrified by this overly disgusting place. The bathroom was entirely covered with black mildew stains, the shower head was broken and the toilet smelled like it hasn't been cleaned for ages. The duvet had white stains on it and the hairdryer and telephone which were promoted on the website didn't exist, the door didnâ€™t close properly and the key card was broken. Although they didnâ€™t fix the shower for two days, we had to pay the full price â€“ service simply doesnâ€™t exist at the fantasia hotel. If you want to enjoy your stay in Amsterdam, I suppose any other place is better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Panicked Girlfriend!”
Reviews.Author: BelfastCouple3
Reviews.Content: First thoughts walking in was decent especialy arriving at 3 in the morning after a delayed flight! The stairs are very very steep and there is no elevator so it is hard to get suitcase up and down nevermind it being hard just to walk up and down it! Staff wasnt very helpful and on your way to your room depending on what floor your on you wil see cockroach traps everywhere! Room was small for two people and if your expecting a double bed expect two single beds put together (uncomfortable) ! The breakfast wasnt to good all it was is toast and tea (self service). The location was good, 5min walk from my favourite coffeeshop! 5-10 min walk from dam square. girlfriend was not impressed and near had a panic attack when seeing the traps and the run down apperance of inside. wouldnt go back in my opinion! overall the best thing is the location and also clean sheets!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: katechem
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a small double room. Initial thoughts were that the room was very small (though just about big enough for two, the bed was not a full sized double) and a bit tatty. However, it was clean and tidy, the staff were friendly and the location (on a quiet canal) was wonderful. Considering the room was considerably cheaper than others available in Amsterdam when I booked, and other areas of the city we could have ended up in (would not have enjoyed staying in the middle of the red light district for example), think it was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Clean”
Reviews.Author: RenpBrighton
Reviews.Content: This was a very cheap option for a quad room and we were expecting something very basic for our money- when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms looked like a students dorm but they were clean and the ones on the second floor were nice a big. The staff were very helpful and we found we were only 10mins walk from most of the main attarctions and restaurants, or a 2min walk from a tram stop that ran everywhere. All in all a very nice place and a brilliant holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Drin
Reviews.Content: Myself & Husband and another couple were due to stay at this hotel in September this year. We had our flights booked and were researching into budget hotels for our stay when we came across this hotel. My husband contacted the hotel directly and booked two double rooms and agreed a price. The gentleman said he would forward us a confirmation email. When we did not receive this confirmation email, I emailed the hotel directly but still heard nothing. My husband then phoned the hotel again only to be told that they had cancelled our booking due to that fact that the gentleman had under quoted us and that his boss said this price was too low!! So they cancelled our booking and never told us. I just want people to be warned as to the individuals you are dealing with. Make sure that you have a confirmation email stating exactly the room rates agreed. We could have easily arrived over in Amsterdam without any where to stay. I just seems to me that they have very poor hotel service - no apology or anything was offered - just rudeness!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: KayleighMT
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fantasia was a wonderful find! I stayed there with three other friends just before Christmas, 2007, and we booked it over the internet. I must admit, I was a bit doubtful at first, with the rooms being so cheap, but I was pleased to discover that it was a fantastic little hotel for those on a budget. Clean, tidy rooms, an amazing shower and very, very friendly staff! Would recommend it to all, and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, noisy and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: susanelena
Reviews.Content: The room was ridiculously small. My boyfriend could easily touch both walls at the same time and there was only a gap of a foot to walk around the bed. The ceilings were also very low, I'm 5ft 9 and banged my hands off the ceiling every time I changed my top. The bed was uncomfortable and the springs creaked so much that we ended up sleeping with the mattress on the floor as it was comfier. The walls were incredibly thin and even the noise of people walking up stairs echoed around the hotel to a deafening level. Our French neighbours spent most of the night shouting and screaming at each other but even after complaining to the hotel staff the noise persisted. Breakfast was typical Dutch bread, cheese and ham but the quality was poor so we ended up eating at the cafe around the corner instead. The tea and coffee making facilities in the room consisted of a few teabags that were never replenished and 2 dirty steel cups, one of which didn't have a handle. The room was advertised as having an FM Radio but this seemed to be a pre-war relic which was impossible to tune in to any station. The room also had a ladybird infestation which I thought extremely odd given the fact we were there in December. The location was fine and the shower was the only good thing about the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well-located and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmerlin33
Reviews.Content: This was a trip of two halves - the hotel was good, friendly, well located and had a good room. The problem was that for the first two days of our four day stay the hotel had double booked us and we were transferred to the Marnix, which is a horrible hotel a little West of this one. Obviously this had to count against this hotel, but if we separate out the experience then it's fair to say this was really nice. We had a view of the canal which is pretty and peaceful, the room was a good size with a good bathroom. The hotel is inexpensive and breakfast was decent. The front desk was friendly and apologetic about the error. I'd book again - just make sure they really do have your booking!

Reviews.Title: “New Ownership”
Reviews.Author: Xefian
Reviews.Content: This hotel changed ownership on Sept. 1 2007. The building is still the same,but gone is the classy welcoming touch of the old regime,. Replaced by a cold hard cash approach , and for the most part snippy staff. ( one of the reception staff was quite pleasent) No welcoming cup of coffee to the weary jet-lagged US arrivees (breakfast doesn't start until 8 you see ,and its locked up tight before that-). No we'll get your rooms for you as soon as we can -It was 14:30 before we could get in . Breakfast is literally a toaster, bread,cheese,salami ,and a grudgingly given small pot of coffee . I suppose you're safe enough here ,though one of the more recent reviews here makes me wonder about that . Theres still construction going on, on the Hermatige just across the canal ,can get noisy early . They weren't good at all at answering pre-trip emails, in which I asked about any changes in hotel policies. Too bad about what happened here, as this was ,for a few years a real gem in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, cheap rate”
Reviews.Author: joyful80
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel, and found it to be pleasant and comfortable. We had a large double room which was bigger than I expected. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the beds were very comfy. The ensuite bathroom was well decorated, and the toilet/shower were clean and well stocked. As other comments mention the stairs being steep, yes they were. We only stayed for one night so didn't have that much luggage to carry, but I can undertand how other guests found this awkward! The breakfast selection was a little limited (bread/toaster/cake/peanut butter/chocolate spread/jam & marmalade/tea,coffee and orange juice) but for the price it was adequate!!!! The dining area was very welcoming and relaxing. My summary is for 99 euros for the room including the breakfast for 2 people, it was well worth it. If you are just looking for a place to sleep. I strongly recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Best 1/2 Star Hotel I Now”
Reviews.Author: mozartik
Reviews.Content: We have been 5 days in hotel Fanatasia during the IBC event whit 5 persons of our company.Clean rooms,perfect location,very helpfull and friendly staf,cheap prices and quit midle in the center.For us it was perfect!We will come back every IBC event in sep back to hotel fantasia.Thanks...

Reviews.Title: “Basic and central”
Reviews.Author: A-Canadian-in-London
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room on the top floor (pictures attached) - the room was quite small (there was only just enough room to walk between the beds) but comfortable, and there was a big closet to store suitcases. The beds were comfortable, although I found it a little weird having the head of the bed facing the door with no headboard. The location is very quiet - the canal and street the hotel is on is quiet and my room faced the back, which looked over the garden to the houses behind. Unfortunately the walls are paper thin, and so you'll be woken up when your neighbours come in (at almost 2am, and from the sound of it kept tripping over the furniture) plus you'll hear their conversations, radio, and sexual activity. Bring earplugs if you're there on a Saturday night (Sunday night was much quieter). The breakfast was basic but decent (tea, coffee, oj, toast, waffles (the pre-packaged kind, not the American syrup-drenched kind), gingerbread cake, ham, cheese, and a bowl of fresh fruit. The staff on the desk were friendly and helpful. The bathroom was fine - very small but clean. The maid service doesn't do much (she swapped my used coffee cup for a fresh one and emptied the bins, but didn't tidy the bathroom or make the bed) but I don't care about that stuff anyway when I'm only staying for a few nights. The location is a quiet residential district but still very close to the centre of town (for the red light district, train station and shopping streets), and an easy walk to the museum district, and a 30 minute walk or 5-10 minutes on the tram for the Jorden district - which I've probably just spelled wrong (for the Anne Frank House)

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you don't have too much luggage”
Reviews.Author: daruz
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to find a cheap place with private bathroom in Amsterdam, and the Fantasia was a good answer. The hostel is in a nice quiet area of the city. Trams run 3 minutes walking, and there you can find a couple of bar and restaurants. The place is an old house, that means that is very narrow and several flights high, with a very tight stair...so forget to take too much or heavy luggage. The room was Ok, some of them with view to the canal. All of them have private bathroom, which is a good plus. It looks clean, but an update would be nice. The breakfast is good, but don't expect hot food. Tea, coffe, bread, ham, cheese, orange juice, etc. The breakfast room is very nice, and the staff is friendly. It would be nice is they begin serving the breakfast little earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break weekend”
Reviews.Author: lynne0171
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fantasia hotel the weekend 23/24 March. We were four girls sharing a room which had 4 single beds. We got a really good welcome from the lady who runs the hotel and lots of information and advice from her. The hotel is perfectly situated for a ten minute stroll into the hub of the City. Breakfast was continental, very good quality and very fresh. The hotel and bedroom was very clean. It is a basic hotel which you wouldn't go to for a luxurious romantic weekend but it is perfect for using as a base to explore Amsterdam with a group of pals. I would definetely recommend this to others for that purpose. Useful to note - we got a cab from the station to the hotel which cost us 20 euros. The cab on the return journey cost us 10. You get ripped off by the cab drivers if you look like a tourist just off the train and don't haggle.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Match”
Reviews.Author: Xanten
Reviews.Content: Have spent a total of about 14 nights during the last two years here. Plusses- Staff, Premises,Location,Price. Staff are friendly, sharing,helpful,can quickly cross from hotel staff to friends,an example being that whilst there during a recent Dutch Election I was invited to accompany one of the staff to witness the voting process ,after showing interest in the matter. ...Premises- 1700s Canal House . Attractively kept,Lovely private garden area, nice hotel lounge. Cozy reception area. Located right around the corner from the MAgere Bridge and a quick walk from WaterlooPlein , its within walking distance from most any Amsterdam attraction,but close to tram should you be so inclined. Also the relative peacefullness of the Nieuwe Keizersgracht is welcome. We've stayed in what's billed as a Large double -and it was clean, comfortable ,plenty large for even a weeks stay . Hot water was plentiful,and truly hot. Our travelling companions who stayed in the smaller single rooms had no complaints either. I have no real negatives to report ,but one should be aware that the Luckytravellers has no elevator . There is a sort of Counter-Culture vibe to the place ,which we Love -You Are after all in Amsterdam . The hotel lounge is "Smoker Friendly" shall we say. Breakfast includes plentiful Coffee/Thee,fruit and the usual Dutch selection of Breads and Cheese. No problem here. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when in Amsterdam ,and hope to visit many times in the future .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Boasty
Reviews.Content: I booked this due to the reviews on the site - before the most recent posting was put up about the place going down hill. There's nothing actually wrong with this hotel. The location is excellent, the external part of the house is beautiful on a lovely canal. I was just very disappointed by the inside. The hall smelt of something odd (!), our room (whilst clean) was shabby. I just felt disappointed by the start of our holiday and so wouldn't recommend this hotel. If you can't get anywhere else, then do stay here - it's not BAD. I just thought I could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone downhill under new ownership”
Reviews.Author: uitsmijter
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Fantasia. First visit: Great location, great price, courteous and helpful staff, clean and comfortable (but small) room with private bath, breakfast platter prepared by owners consisting of fresh bread and pastries (we saw the owner returning from the bakery on his bike), hard-boiled egg, fresh coffee and tea, delivered to your table. Second visit: Great location, great price, aloof staff, no sign of owners, same exact room but bathroom smelled awful and sheets were stained, "buffet" breakfast with stale bread still in the plastic bag from the supermarket, not much else to choose from. It was unfortunate that the quality of the hotel had declined so much since our first visit, given the care and attention to detail shown by the previous owners. Maybe they've moved on to another inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Service, Good Area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Managed to get a booking at short notice. Single room (shower across corridor) breakfast E50 per night. The shower was not en-suite (all other rooms are) but i was the only room using it and it was spotless. A power shower in Amsterdam is a plus. Room was comfortable and cleaned/changed every day. Breakfast served between 8-10am in pleasant dining room. Standard Dutch breakfast served each day (could have used more orange juice) was sufficient. The only thing my room really needed was a small fridge that would keep down the cost of constantly eating out. The area is within easy reach of everywhere, (100 yards from skinny bridge). It is only 2 metro stops and 5 tram stops from central station. The main advantage is that there is no tourist traffic whatsoever even though it is a main canal route. If staying for more than a few days this can be a bonus after the novelty of staying in a more touristy area wears off. The email exchange and subsequent booking by phone was excellent. The owners and staff are friendly and helpful. There is no curfew. I would recommend this as a base for exploring the wonderful city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Super place”
Reviews.Author: JRGreen
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Fantasia for 7 days - after reading all of the great reviews we thought it was worth a try and it certainly did pay off. Amsterdam is much more expensive than it was when the guilder was used, but The Fantasia was still reasonably priced, the owners Adrie and Trudie were very nice and the breakfast was really good. Rooms were cleaned every day (rare for budget hotels in Holland). Not quite as conveniently located as some places in Amsterdam but much more quiet, so well worth it. They have a very cute cat, too!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, it's friendly, clean, central and rooms are at budget prices. The lovely owners are daft on all things cow! Breakfast is fresh and filling. I loved the hotel and would recommend it very highly and would certainly remain loyal to Hotel Fantasia when i visit amsterdam in the future. It's easy to find, less than a 2 minute walk from Waterlooplein station which is 3 stops till Central station though you can walk to central station from the hotel in just over a quarter of an hour. The rooms aren't exactly spacious, there's no restaurant or bar but you couldn't beat the service, location or price. I'm sure you won't be disappointed - it's everything you'd need.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel beside typical Amsterdam "gracht" . Owners very friendly-made my stay a pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Canal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndiJane
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have just returned from a short stay at the Fantasia Hotel from 31 May until 2 June. We were very happy with our quaint little attic rooms which were spotlessley clean. The breakfast was very nice, plenty to eat and lots of lovely fresh bread. The owners were very nice. We were a little worried about the location of the hotel but although we didnt walk into the town centre (we had a 3 day tram pass) we were sure it wasnt a very long walk. The only problem was the stairs which were very steep but we were certain the exercise was good for all of us. We hope to return to the Fantasia hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fantasia - Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Amsterdam in July 2002 and stayed at the Hotel Fantasia. It was on a beautiful side street, just off a canal. We were pleased with our hotel and the owner was very friendly. We were within walking distance of many of the city's sights. The city is beautiful and we had a wonderful visit. ...

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Hermitage Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwe Keizersgracht 16, Amsterdam 1018 , The Netherlands (Formerly Hotel Fantasia)
